Portal 2 is much more complex than the original Portal, with three additional features, speed, bouncing and the ability to mark areas for portals that would not be accessible otherwise.  This is not a game you can just play, you have to think your way through every level.

It's a good idea to play the first part of the Portal series first.
This sequel continutes the story, the fun and the gameplay of the first part and in some way even enhances it.
During the mid-game gameplay becomes a little repetitive and I got bored for a while but it's still worth playing and following the storry till the end.
The multiplayer part can be a lot of fun with friends even if it lacks some long term motivation for me.

This game is a classic. A puzzle platforming game for the ages. The sequel takes what Portal did well and magnifies that along with a longer main campaign than the original which I think the first game needed. If your computer can run it, get it. It goes for dirt cheap on sale and packs plenty of bang for a buck.

One of the best puzzle games with character I have ever played.

Great game worth every penny, though I would recommend waiting until a steam sale before buying. 
[i] (Goes to ~¬£2 for the original game and sequel!) [/i]

I would recommend beating the first game before playing the second, as it may be challenging to newer players.

After the game has been beaten, there is a level builder with a whole community working on levels to play. 
[i] (Infinite replayability!) [/i]

TLDR: I would recommend the game to puzzle or platformer fans, or just people who have enjoyed the first game.
